data.name: Lowest and Highest Primes
data.description:
Given an array of positive integers, return an array of the lowest prime number and the highest prime number from the given array

For example,  
Given: [1, 5, 83, 45, 7, 8]  
Return: [5, 83]

For example, 
Given: [6, 5, 88, 5, 3, 18, 79]  
Return: [3, 79]

The highest and lowest prime may end up being the same number if there is only one prime number. If that is the case return the same number twice.

For example, 
Given: [1, 5, 88, 45, 8, 8]  
Return: [5, 5]

If there is no prime number in the array return -1 for both the low and the high numbers.

For example,  
Given: [9,   64, 50,  100, 586, 2440, 345381]  
Return: [-1, -1]

No number will be higher than 1,000,000.

A key feature is determining if a number is a prime number. If you want to work on that first, here is a simpler kata for doing that: https://www.codewars.com/kata/5262119038c0985a5b00029f
